fields.value: Massachusetts Archives Collection. v.188-Revolution Petitions, 1782-1783. SC1/series 45X, Petition of Stephen Webb

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Petition subject: Military service

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:13909121

Date of creation: 17820000

Petition location: Salem

Legislator, committee, or address that the petition was sent to: Several names from a committee

Selected signatures:

  1. Stephen Webb

Actions taken on dates: 1782-11-08

Legislative action: Committed and leave to withdraw on November 8, 1782

Total signatures: 1

Legislative action summary: Committed, leave to withdraw

Legal voter signatures (males not identified as non-legal): 1

Female only signatures: No

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Additional archivist notes: Primus, sergeant, forts, wages [with certificate of selectmen of Salem]

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: Massachusetts Archives volume 188, pages 134-136

Acknowledgements: Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities (PW-5105612), Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth, Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study at Harvard University, Center for American Political Studies at Harvard University, Institutional Development Initiative at Harvard University, and Harvard University Library.
